content: hey guys I'm back with some more end-of-the-world terrain now today we're
gonna do a tree and you're saying oh another tree yeah okay so but yeah this
is this tree definitely has some merits I have designed this to be a urban tree
so it has a base that would fit with an urban environment but it's a really nice
technique and you could use up for your fantasy games too or any games for that
matter but I was going after a dead tree and you know the apocalypse kind of
setting so that's what I'm aiming for but yeah you could you could modify this
easily to fit in any setting just change the base up so let's go the table and
we'll start crafting that alright to start out for this project I'm gonna use
a piece of thin cardboard this is an old FedEx box scrap okay so now I have a
circle I'm gonna use that to trace my base so I'll go ahead and now I want to
have like a small retaining wall around this because it's going to be like in a
city so I'm going to draw another circle and I'm going to use another smaller
circle inside to kind of okay so now I got two circles so now what I'm going to
do is I'm going to cut this out and then I'll cut this out and apply it to that
and this will act as the retaining wall for the tree okay so now I've got both
pieces cut out so I'm going to do is take this and I had to cut to get in the
center I'm gonna put it on here and I'll just use my small glue gun to do that no
I've got that glued on them and do a little bit of texture with my glue gun
and I'm going to kind of simulate rocks at bricks on this so I'll just start
here and I'm just going to kind of do dabs and be careful it's it's very easy
to put these dabs together so don't do that
all right so that's what it looks like so I'll finish this up and then move on
to the next step all right so what my blobs Harden a bit and not going to do a
little more detail on them you can't don't try to do this to this step too
quick because when they're wet it's just gonna be really hard to do this so I'm
just gonna add a little more texture to them fill out any stones that didn't get
all the way filled out because I had to back off from the glue gun
okay now careful when you're going around here you don't want to glue
yourself to the thing all right there we go so I add a little more detail to
those stones and now we'll start working on the tree so in this yet another tree
video I am using a easy to find resource and it is fuzzy sticks that I okay no
jokes please okay fuzzy sticks are just pipe cleaners
all right so now let's move on and we'll show you what to do with these pipe
cleaners again no jokes please I've got five here and I'm going to kind of just
twist them up now I could get more than one out of
here so what I'm going to do is I'm going to cut this in half so I'll do
this okay these are some fairly thick scissors so now I've got the basic tree
there what I can do is I can for the branches I can pull these out of it if I
didn't want to have as many I could kind of twist them around another branch
maybe I'll do that and then there so I got some branches there all right I need
something to anchor the the twigs that I'm going to put on well not the twigs
but the the branches that I'm going to extend these with so I so that's why I
did that and then I can for the roots I'm going to pull them out a little just
a little bit not as much as the branches all right so you can kind of
get a shape there all right so that's a nice little shape tree there now what
I'm going to do is I'm going to use my white glue I've got some aleene's tacky
glue here you can use glue all or whatever kind of white glue you have
just not school glue and I'm gonna start saturating this with the glue so just
like kind of like the toilet paper technique we're going to saturate this
so give it you know give it a liberal coating and then just start working it
into the the pipe cleaners themselves so what I'll do is I'll finish this up let
it dry and then we'll come back for the next step my tree is nice and solid and
it still has some give to it which is one thing I like about this too
that if you bump it during play you know it's not hard it'll give a little bit
but it won't go out of shape so I got my base here that I'm going to put it on
and you can see it's a little big for that so I just need to trim that up a
bit so I'll trim up the roots and then we'll
move to the next step so there we go I've got the roots nice and trimmed and
they easily fit in within this circle now the question comes now
do I want to glue this to the base first and then I do some detailing on the tree
with the hot glue or do it on the tree first I think I'm going to do it on the
tree first before I go it to the base so I'm going to take my hot glue and I'm
using my small gun and I'm going to kind of drag it up and down the tree here so
I'll give it some nice texture it's a bit prickly with the the fuzz that's on
the the pipe cleaners and this will give it make it a little more salt looking
texture so there you can see what I'm doing there you can kind of see that the
fuzz sticking out from the glue when I glued it so I'm going to finish this up
and it'll move on to the next step so since I want this to be a dead tree
I'm going to use just some branches on it and I've got these this cheap this is
it this was a $2.00 plant that I got at the store and I'm just going to pull
these limbs off okay and I'm going to use those for the branches of the tree
so I finished gluing my tree up except for the base there and what I want to do
is take those limbs that I've pulled off a plastic plant and put on the tips of
these branches so I didn't glue the ends here so these will fit on the ends and
what I'm gonna do is I'm gonna go ahead and glue those on now and then we'll
move on to the next step I've applied the branches of the tips of the limbs as
you can see I've got them going in different directions to get a kind of a
different you know a fuller tree effect so now what I want to do is now that
I've got this on is take my glue gun and I'm gonna they're just kind of set on
the tip so what I'm gonna do is kind of blend them in with the glue gun
and now not only secure it better but it'll hide that transition okay so we'll
finish these up and then I'm gonna apply it to the base okay so I have my face
here and I want to apply the tree to it so I'll take the tree and I'm just gonna
hot glue it on there so I'll just put a big group of hot glue on there
I'll let it set up and now we'll move on the next step now I'm going to blend the
base end with the glue gun so I'll just pull up pull down on the base and just
kind of blend it in so I'll finish that and then we'll come back to the next
step I've got this nicely secured to the base and now I'm going to fill in a
little bit of that planter area there so I'm gonna use my white glue okay and I'm
gonna fill this in with glue now I've got this filled it with white
glue as you can see and what I'm going to do is I'm going to fill it with sand
but unlike what I normally do with the construction sand I'm going to use place
and so sand is place and is just sand without the extra larger aggregate in it
so I'm going to I got a container a place in here and I'm just going to pour
it on that pour it on that glue alright and then
I'll let that dry and we'll move on to the next step now you may be wondering
why I'm using play sand and not my normal construction sand well you know
planner thing a situation like this in a city there really wouldn't be like you
know different sized rocks and stuff in the planner area where the tree is so I
decided that I'm just going to use a place and for the earth of the project
so we'll let this dry and then we'll move on to the next step so my base is
dried and now I'm going to reveal what it looks like so I'll just knock all
that off all right so we got a nice nice base there okay so now what I'm going to
do next is I will take this guy and paint them the black and then we'll work
from there so from the tree I'm going to use a dark
brown and I face painted my tree black and just so that came out really nice so
now I'm going to start painting this I'm going to water the brown down quite a
bit and one nice technique to do the branches is just to put them on the
paper here and just pull your brush over it that way you can get the branches
stable while you're painting them instead of them flipping away as you try
to paint them and then just turn them over and these these particular branches
have a little bit of fuzz on them from the plant but that's fine that works
fine okay so now I'm gonna finish painting the rest of this up and then we
will move to the next step let this dry now move to the next step our tree air
is dried and you can see it's just a dark brown on there now I want to do
some detail on the trees so I'm gonna I want to make it look like a sickly tree
so I'm going to use a Mississippi mud and then a very light gray so kinda like
a maple tree might be so I'm gonna get the Mississippi mud and then just start
get the trunk there now I'll finish this up and now while the trees still wet I
want to do a little bit of gray on it so I'll get that gray and I'm not cleaning
my brush or anything I just run it up a little bit about the trunk on the
branches I'm just barely touching and I'm not putting that much on there just
a little bit to give it like character you have a really light touch with this
he's difficult to get in some of those branches like I say just get the tip of
the brush on there don't look at the brush up too much alright there we go
there's our tree so now I'll move on to the next step
kind of my idea about this basis there's like some cement with some stones stuck
in this in the stone so what I'm going to do is I'm going to use my country
gray and just use a very small brush and then just kind of start
going in between the stones to make that look like cement
okay so I'll finish that up and then we'll come back in go to the next step
all right there we go there's my base and you can see the cement between
outside of the edging now what I want to do the stones I want to do the stones a
different color more like a brown stone kind of thing so I'm going to use a
coffee color which is a very light like a tannish color and then I saw just kind
of used my small version just kind of drag it over those stones
now remember I've already left the brown on them from the initial wash so they
are getting the highlight and everything but I'm just adding the this tan color
all right so there we go there's our base now one last thing to do and we'll
be done so for the next stage I just simply took my I use an earth Brown and
then just dry brush the sand on the base to make it look like dirt so now our
tree is ready for the table and we'll take it there and talk about it for a
minute hey guys here's our finished dead tree next to some survivors and I think
it really looks nice it really looks like it belongs in the urban jungle with
that base we got going on there and it really just looks like a dead poor dead
tree nice texture very sturdy and light so there we go there's a nice tree to
grace your zombie apocalypse or into the world scenarios and the urban jungle
setting and I'll see you next time on the craft hey crafters I hope you've
enjoyed this episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons
of other videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain for the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who give advice I have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and craft
